title: Best Way to Obtain a Doctor’s Note (Plus Example Templates)

steps.title: Schedule an appointment with your doctor.
steps.content: Schedule an appointment with your doctor. We know it’s difficult to see a doctor on short notice or if you’re feeling too poorly to leave home. If seeing a physician in person isn’t feasible, schedule a virtual appointment using a service like TelaDoc or MDLIVE, and the doctor who visits with you over the phone can send you an excuse note electronically. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tell your doctor about your medical issue.
steps.content: Tell your doctor about your medical issue. Your doctor must verify the problem and determine the best course of treatment. This is important because the nature of the treatment and your estimated recovery time will dictate how long you’ll need to be absent.

steps.title: Ask the doctor to fill out and sign a medical excuse note.
steps.content: Ask the doctor to fill out and sign a medical excuse note. Do this as soon as possible after the examination, so neither you nor your physician forget about it. In some instances, the doctor may ask you when you would prefer to return to work or school. In that case, choose a date that you believe you will be able to recover sufficiently by to resume your regular duties or attend classes. If your doctor believes you can return to work or school right away, but you disagree, find another doctor and get a second opinion. Otherwise, you’ll have to negotiate absences without the benefit of a medical excuse note.

steps.title: Make a copy of the note and provide the original to your workplace or school.
steps.content: Make a copy of the note and provide the original to your workplace or school. Keep a record of all medical records associated with your visit, as well, in case they decide to investigate further. [2] X Trustworthy Source US Equal Employment Opportunity Commission U.S. government agency that enforces civil rights in the workplace Go to source The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) allows covered employers to contact a worker's doctor and ask for additional information about their health or disability if the inquiry is related to the job and shown to be a business necessity.

steps.title: Work Example
steps.content: Work Example To whom it may concern: John Doe is excused from work from October 16th through October 18th, 2024 due to a medical condition as evaluated by this office. He may return to work on October 21st, 2024, and assume light duty. He may not lift more than 30 pounds of weight until November 1st, 2024. Sincerely, [Doctor’s signature]

steps.title: School Example
steps.content: School Example Dear [name of principal or school administrators], Elsa Mae is excused from school for April 14th, 2024 due to a visit she made to this office. She may return to school on April 15th, 2024, and resume her normal classes and after-school activities. Sincerely, [Doctor’s signature]

steps.title: Avoid using a fake note at work since you could be fired or even criminally charged.
steps.content: Avoid using a fake note at work since you could be fired or even criminally charged. Your employer or their insurer can easily discover if the note is fake by simply calling the doctor’s office. Furthermore, a genuine doctor’s note requires a doctor’s signature, meaning you’d need to forge one if you’re writing it yourself. Forgery is against the law, and medical note forgers who get caught can face up to 1 year in prison, 3 years of probation, and $1000 in penalties – not to mention the loss of their reputation and livelihood. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Schools can punish students who forge doctor’s notes by suspending or expelling them.
steps.content: Schools can punish students who forge doctor’s notes by suspending or expelling them. The incident will remain a black mark on the student’s record and follow them to any other schools they attend afterward, as well as open them up to criminal charges. [4] X Research source

steps.title: A yearly checkup or health screening.
steps.content: A yearly checkup or health screening. Monitoring and maintaining your health is important and worth missing a day or two from your job or class. Don’t skip your regular checkups or screenings for diseases like cancer. Instead, ask for a doctor’s note verifying you attended your appointment and prove you weren’t playing hooky that day. [5] X Trustworthy Source MedlinePlus Collection of medical information sourced from the US National Library of Medicine Go to source

steps.title: A minor illness or injury.
steps.content: A minor illness or injury. If you have a nasty cold or some other non-serious health issue knocking you off your feet, get a doctor’s note so you can stay home and recover.

steps.title: A highly contagious disease like COVID-19, influenza, or strep throat.
steps.content: A highly contagious disease like COVID-19, influenza, or strep throat. Your principal or employer will be glad you decided to stay home if you come down one of these super spreaders. They may also require a doctor’s note showing you’re cleared to return to work or school.

steps.title: A serious health condition requiring you to reduce stress and physical activity.
steps.content: A serious health condition requiring you to reduce stress and physical activity. This could be a pregnancy, chronic back condition, diabetes, cancer, or something else that is worsened by strenuous tasks. [6] X Research source Employees or employee family members whose illnesses fall under the Family and Medical Leave Act’s (FMLA) definition of “serious health conditions” are entitled to 12 weeks of unpaid, job-protected leave every 12 months (providing their employer is covered). [7] X Trustworthy Source US Department of Labor Federal department responsible for promoting the wellbeing of workers Go to source

steps.title: You may avoid getting suspended, fired, or expelled over missing work or school.
steps.content: You may avoid getting suspended, fired, or expelled over missing work or school. Remember to check your employer or school’s absence policies to ensure a doctor’s note is sufficient documentation to excuse your missed days.

steps.title: You may get paid for the time you took off for medical reasons.
steps.content: You may get paid for the time you took off for medical reasons. Federal law doesn’t require employers to provide sick leave, so talk to your human resources department to find out if you’re entitled to pay on the days you’re absent due to illness. If so, they may require you to provide a medical excuse note to prove you took time off for a legitimate reason.

steps.title: You can treat and recover from medical issues during business hours.
steps.content: You can treat and recover from medical issues during business hours. Most doctor’s offices are only open from Monday to Friday, so being able to take off during these times by acquiring a medical excuse note is crucial.

steps.title: It’s legal and you can easily obtain it.
steps.content: It’s legal and you can easily obtain it. All it takes is making a virtual or in-person appointment with a doctor and asking them or their staff for a medical excuse note. Even better, you won’t risk being charged with forgery as you would with a fake note.

steps.title: Do employers verify medical excuse notes?
steps.content: Do employers verify medical excuse notes? Yes, both your employer and their insurer can call the office where you obtained your doctor’s note to verify the note’s authenticity. They can’t, however, ask them for details of your visit without your prior authorization, as that would be a violation of HIPAA privacy law. [8] X Trustworthy Source US Department of Health and Human Services Federal department responsible for improving the health and well-being of Americans Go to source

steps.title: Do you always have to provide a medical excuse note when you’re sick?
steps.content: Do you always have to provide a medical excuse note when you’re sick? Not always. Some employers only require a note after 3 days of absence. Check with the HR department at your workplace or your school administrator’s office to see if they require a doctor’s note for sick days.

steps.title: Can you get a medical excuse note for dental appointments and elective procedures?
steps.content: Can you get a medical excuse note for dental appointments and elective procedures? Yes, anytime you visit a doctor or a qualified healthcare provider, you can ask for a note to excuse your absence from work or school for medical purposes.

steps.title: Do you need a medical excuse note for military-related absences?
steps.content: Do you need a medical excuse note for military-related absences? In this case, the military will provide an official excuse for you to show your employer or school. You don’t need to get a note from a doctor. [9] X Research source
